entry.title: Re: Questions regarding Business Partner Migration via Mi...
entry.content:
Hello @RYOGA_HOSHI 

The previous answer from @Moumita2001  is correct. The error happens when the Customer Account Group is filled in General Data. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the account group is derived from the BP Grouping.

Possible solution

Leave the Customer/Supplier Account Group blank in General Data.

Use a standard BP Grouping such as  BP01/BP02

If you must use a custom BP Grouping, ensure it is currently mapped to the desired account group.

  • BP â†’ Customer: default account group
  • BP â†’ Supplier: default account group

If there is a misalignment, you will see CNV_DMC_SIN 587. Assignment of BP grouping is not possible

Useful SAP Documentation references

  • SAP Help: Migrate Your Data â€“ Migration Cockpit (F3473)
  • KBA-2805232 - How to define which Customer or Supplier Account Group(s) are created for a BP Grouping in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: New Developer forums!
entry.content:
Since the platform migration last year so many of you have asked "Where is ABAP?" and "Where are the questions about ABAP?" - we heard you loud an clear. We are therefore thrilled to finally be able to answer your questions as we are launching new Developer forums today!

 

This will be the new home for our developers and technical audience in the SAP Community, and we are starting with forums on the following topics: 

  • ABAP (classic): Everything general around ABAP, the ABAP platform or classic ABAP development. (including DDIC, ABAP List Viewer (ALV), ABAP SQL, DYNP including PBO and PAI)
  • ABAP Cloud: All ABAP Cloud related topics, including ABAP Core Data Services (CDS), ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), and ABAP for cloud development.
  • Artificial Intelligence : AI in general, SAP Business AI, Joule, Joule Agents, Joule for Consultants, Joule for Developers or AI Foundation.
  • SAP CAP: Everything on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. 
  • Data and Analytics:
    • SAP Business Data Cloud, including Databricks, Datasphere, Analytics Cloud and Business Warehouse.
    • SAP HANA and SAP HANA Cloud.
    • SAP Master Data Governance.
  • Frontend / UI5 / SAP Fiori: All frontend-related topics, including SAPUI5, OpenUI5 and SAP Fiori. 
  • Integration: For all SAP Integration related topics. (not limited to SAP Integration Suite)
  • Tooling, including SAP Build: For all topics related to any SAP development tool, like SAP Build Code and ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. 

But more than just launching a home for our developer/technical audience, we are also bringing back forums as a content type, including a more compact forum feed, threaded replies and not least a filter that many of you have requested for questions with no answers. We will get into the details of the new forums below ðŸ™‚ 

All developer forums consist of a hub with options both for asking questions (forum) and for publishing blog posts: 

To be able to publish content in the forums, you first need to join the group/forum, therefore please make sure you hit the "Join Group" button: 

Joining the forum also automatically triggers a subscription to new content published in the group.
You can check or change your subscriptions and notifications in your account settings here. 

Forums

As mentioned above, we are bringing back forums as a content type. 
This first iteration of the new forum feed does not contain any preview of content, thus making it easier/faster for everyone to scroll down the list to identify the questions they might have an answer to. 
The feed gives you an overview over who asked the question, when it was published, and you can also see who replied to it last (and when), if there are replies. 
We also included a filter that many of you have requested, "No answers", which shows you all questions with no interaction. This is different to "No Solutions", as the no solutions filter will give you an overview over questions with an answer, but where the author has not yet accepted one of the answers as the right solution. 
Questions with a solution can easily be identified in the feed with the green checkmark to the left of the question. The second iteration of the forum feed will make it even easier to quickly identify questions with accepted solutions in the feed. 
We also kept the icons for views, answers/replies and kudos/views in the feed. 

 

Another change with forums, compared to the Q&As, is that we are bringing back threaded replies to questions. For forums there is no difference if it is a comment asking for clarification, or if you know the answer to the question. The correct answer can be found anywhere in the threaded conversation, and the author has the option to accept any answer as the correct solution to the question. 
As you can see in the screenshot below, it is not possible to accept any reply, anywhere in the conversation as the solution: 

 

When a question has an accepted solution, it will behave the same way as the Q&As. The question will have an "Go to solution" marker on top, and the accepted answer will be displayed directly below the question with a green checkmark and a green box to identify as the correct solution:

 

Other than joining the group, no special permissions is needed to ask your question in the forums. Even if you are new to the SAP Community, and come here to find help, you can do so immediately after creating a new account. 
As everywhere else in the Community, please do not answer questions with AI-generated content. If you don't know the answer, please move on to the next question where you know the answer, instead of trying to build a reputation by publishing AI-generated answers that do not add any value, and in many cases also are misleading or false. 

 

Blog posts

Blog posts in the developer forums will not have a separation between SAP employees and external community users. 
Although the forums will not be curated,  we will keep a close eye on what gets published to ensure the quality of the content is according to our guidelines. Blog posts in the SAP Community should be used to share value and your personal knowledge and expertise. 
The permissions to publish blog posts will follow the rank ladder system, so if you are new to community, your blog posts will be subject to moderation review. Community users who already have permissions to publish blog posts in the "Product and Technology" categories, will be able to publish blog posts directly in the new forums, without moderation. 
You can find more information on moderation in the SAP Community in this article in our Welcome Corner group. 

The "Featured Topics" section is curated by the SAP Community team for now, and will focus on highlighting important product updates that should not be missed. 

 

Pilot-phase

The launch today is a pilot, as we want to first see how you all respond before we make a final decision on whether or not forums are here to stay. The pilot will run for 3 months, until the end of the year. 

All forums start empty, with no published content. 
The exception is the three groups which we have moved over from the Interest groups, namely "Artificial Intelligence", "Data and Analytics", and "Integration" - these three groups were moved to the new Developers area with their content. 

We will over the next months continuously improve the user experience in the forums and forum feeds, and are as always open to feedback and suggestions. 

And one last thing. We have set the "Application Development and Automation" group to read only for now, to encourage everyone to participate here instead. We will decide what to do with the group and its content once this pilot has ended. 

The SAP Developer News posts from the SAP Developer Advocate team will be published here in the meantime. 

Happy foruming everyone! ðŸ™‚ 

 

Known bugs

On the main forum page, the button still says "Start a Discussion", this will be changed to "Ask a question" as soon as possible: 

 

In the mobile portrait view of the forum feed, the last filter tab may break to another line in some cases. We are aware of this, and it will be fixed in one of our upcoming releases:

entry.title: Finance Connect: Strategic Transformation, Not Just Applications
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

As finance leaders navigate an era where strategic agility isn't just advantageous (it's essential for survival), one statistic stands out: According to Gartner, 62% of CEOs have selected growth as their top business priority for 2024-2025, marking the highest level since 2014.

This surge in focus on growth presents both unprecedented opportunities and fundamental challenges: How do you transform finance from a reactive reporting function into a strategic growth engine that powers real-time decision-making across the enterprise?

For part 3 of this blog series on SAP Connect 2025, Iâ€™m sharing my list of must-attend sessions at SAP Finance Connect 2025. These sessions offer not just technological solutions but a strategic framework that aligns financial operations with growth imperatives for finance leaders and finance technology professionals.

If this is the first time you're hearing about SAP Connect 2025, read this blog first.

 

Flourishing Finance Function

Your organization has ambitious growth targets. Your CEO is pushing for expansion into new markets, product innovation, and operational scaling, adding responsibilities beyond finance to the office of CFO. Yet, when it comes to providing the financial processes and insights needed to fuel these initiatives, your finance team is still wrestling with:

  • Fragmented financial data scattered across multiple systems and departments
  • Manual reconciliation processes that delay critical decision-making
  • Disconnected planning cycles that can't adapt quickly to market changes
  • Limited visibility into real-time performance across business units

The path begins with understanding how connected finance can specifically support your organization's growth priorities.

The need to create a connected financial ecosystem that integrates, extends, and automates your finance solutions and processes can be met with SAP Business Technology Platform. SAP BTP will strengthen your existing (and sometimes reactive) finance processes, transforming them into a proactive strategy that enables your finance function to flourish. Check out sap.com/btp-for-finance page for more in-depth information on how SAP BTP helps deliver better and more efficient Finance processes.

Here are my three must-attend sessions at Finance Connect that will expand how you think about finance technology possibilities:

 

Your must-attend sessions at Finance Connect

Scenario 1: Finance Closing

Your challenge: The Finance function needs to take the driverâ€™s seat in leading the organization to be proactive in responding to changing requirements and strategies. But when it comes to financial close, itâ€™s still a chaotic and manual process with many versions of documents and reviews.  Read about the full use case here.

The Solution: Explore Process Automation with SAP Build to streamline repeated processes. Eliminating manual tasks frees up your employeesâ€™ time, allowing them to focus on strategy and other important activities.

Business Impact: By automating and streamlining repetitive financial closing processes such as data entry and data collection, invoices can be processed 50% faster, with a 55% faster month-end close time.

If this is you, be sure to add this session to your agenda:

A fast close with SAP Advanced Financial Closing and SAP BTP | FIN1909

Wednesday Oct 8 | 11:15 AM â€“ 12:00 PM PDT

 

Scenario 2: Enterprise Performance Management

Your challenge: Your team hopes to drive coordinated business transformation through enterprise performance management. But with multiple ERP and EPM applications, the execution of holistic performance management still struggles with fragmented systems that prevent effective forecasting and strategic alignment across the enterprise.

The Solution: Enterprise performance management technology should integrate easily with existing systems like financial consolidation and group reporting. Discover how SAP Integration Suite connects enterprise systems to streamline data availability, while SAP Build automates processes, enabling AI to deliver more accurate predictions.

Business Impact: In their session FIN2330, PwC shares how they were able to shorten close cycles and improve data accuracy in enterprise performance management.

If this is you, be sure to add these sessions to your agenda:

The EPM evolution: SAP EPM across the value chain | FIN2152

Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:00 AM â€“ 11:20 AM PDT

Driving Financial Agility â€” PwCâ€™s In-House EPM Transformation with Group Reporting | FIN2330

Tuesday Oct 7 | 3:15 PM â€“ 4:00 PM PDT

 

 

Register Now: Start Your Strategic Finance Growth Journey

The goal is to create an intelligent financial nervous system that connects every aspect of your financial operations to drive outcomes. With SAP Business Technology Platform, your finance team can transform how your organization thinks, plans, and executes on growth opportunities.

Register now for Finance Connect 2025 to gain invaluable knowledge, discover SAP Business Technology Platformâ€™s finance use cases, and join a community of organizations turning growth ambitions into a connected reality. Take the first steps to transform your financial operations into a strategic transformation advantage.

 

Check out the following blogs for other SAP Connect events:

  • SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
  • SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary
  • Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success
  • Discover SAP Business Technology Platform at SAP Connect and Spend Connect 2025
  • SAP BTP: Creating Connections at Supply Chain Connect

entry.title: The capacity required of production order decreases to 0 hour when we start production (receive tran
entry.content:
Hello,


When we start producing a production order and transactions have started (confirmation, good receipt), the required capacity drops to 0.000 hours. This can be seen in the planning tools we use like Capacity Scheduling Table or Manage Work Center Capacity

So, let's take an example. I'm creating a production order that should take 22 hours to produce. I have to start it at 1:00 a.m. and finish it at 11:00 p.m.

Before producing it, I clearly see the required capacity of 22 hours in my various tools. But as soon as I start producing, i.e., making transactions, the required capacity goes from 22 hours to 0.000 hours.

How can I ensure that this required capacity decreases according to the confirmed quantities?

Thank you

entry.title: Document management, "Uploaded By" column, how to change to employee name rather than uploader name
entry.content:
In Document Management, employment contracts are currently stored under the Background document entity, and the Uploaded by field shows the name of the person who uploaded the file (e.g., an admin or manager) instead of the employee. This makes it difficult to search and filter documents by employee, since the uploader is often not the contract owner.

Is it possible to configure this so that the Uploaded by field reflects the employee, allowing us to search for contracts directly by employee name?

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: CDS Views - exclude records where a STRING / LOB / CL...
entry.content:
Hi

5 years later, but maybe this will help someone.

Use the CDS table function. Read through the ABAP method of the table function your CDS with string variable. In ABAP, you can use length for the abap.string type.

Like this

Return Select * from YOUR_CDS where length(YOUR_STRING) = 0;

or if you want to see the length in your data add extra column to your table function and in ABAP:

Return Select *, length(YOUR_STRING)  as YOUR_EXTRA_COLUMN from YOUR_CDS;

and then read the data from table function in new CDS.

entry.title: How to rewrite this ABAP SQL join via the CDS associations and SQL Path Expression?
entry.content:
Hello,

Here's my current ABAP SQL join:

SELECT
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem
       INNER JOIN I_SalesDocument
         ON i_salesdocument~SalesDocument = i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~SalesDocument
       INNER JOIN I_PurchaseOrderItem
         ON i_purchaseorderitem~PurchaseOrder = i_salesdocument~PurchaseOrderByCustomer
  FIELDS i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocument,
         i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocumentItem,
         i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~SalesDocument,
         i_salesdocument~PurchaseOrderByCustomer,
         i_purchaseorderitem~CostCenter
  WHERE i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocument  = 'PBD0000061'
    AND i_purchaseorderitem~CostCenter                    <> ' '
  INTO TABLE (lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

I think it can be simplified by using SQL Path Expression. The below code doesn't compile but you get the idea what I want to achieve:

SELECT
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem[ PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061' ]
       \_salesdocument
       \_zzpurchaseorderitem[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ] AS sql_path_expression
  FIELDS DISTINCT costcenter
  WHERE costcenter <> ' '
  INTO TABLE (lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

It doesn't compile because I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem is not a parameterized view.

How can I define the filter on PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061'?

Thank you.

Sandra

My system: S/4HANA On Premises, ABAP 7.58.

entry.title: Re: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against...
entry.content:
Hey mattewwade06,
Thanks, thatâ€™s super helpful to call out â€” we checked the usual suspects:

  • Authorizations: Our comm. user can read PO/ID data and call other released APIs fine. For 101 via Material Documents (V2) the call is authenticated, but the service rejects PurchaseOrder/Delivery for 101 with 400 â€œnot supportedâ€ (expected in Public Cloud).

  • PO status & openness: PO item is open for GR, not final-delivered, and not blocked. We verified GR-based IV settings where relevant.

  • Data completeness: Plant, SLoc, UoM, material master, and (where applicable) batch are present. No special account assignment preventing GR.

  • Runtime observations:

     

    • V4 Inbound Delivery GM endpoint returns 403 (UCON) on our tenant.

    • V2 Material Document deep-insert for 101 gives 400 (by design for Public Cloud).

    • Inbound Delivery (V2) PostGoodsReceipt works only as â€œpost all open qtyâ€; it ignores partials unless we PATCH the delivery item first (qty/batch/sloc), which we implemented.

    • We hit 428 Precondition Required until we added If-Match from the header etag; after that, posting proceeds.

    • In an EWM flavor weâ€™ve also seen VLMOVE/029 (not yet put away), which aligns with process statusâ€”handled via the Warehouse Inbound Delivery A2X where needed.

So net-net: it looks less like a data/PO-status issue and more about which released API path is allowed in Public Cloud. Weâ€™re currently following the SAP-guided sequence:

  1. PATCH inbound delivery item (set the exact qty/batch/sloc to post)

  2. POST PostGoodsReceipt (V2) â†’ system posts 101 for the adjusted open qty

Questions again:

  1. Is there a way to whitelist/enable the V4 GoodsMovement service on Public Cloud, or is it currently not releasedfor our scope?

  2. For EWM tenants, do you recommend any additional status updates (bin/WT steps) via the Warehouse Inbound Delivery A2X before invoking PostGoodsReceipt to avoid VLMOVE/029?

If you see any specific PO-field or customizing that typically blocks 101 via API in Public Cloud beyond the above, happy to double-check. Thanks again!

Hi @anmolacy 

Have you tried the options outlined at https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/sap-successfactors-api-reference-guide-odata-v2/getting-classes-with-web-service ?

"You have two ways of getting a class:

entry.title: Re: Unable to close project / WBS
entry.content:
Hello @MadhuriTaunk 

This error occurs because the system still detects an open commitment on the WBS, such as a purchase requisition, a purchase order item that isn't fully marked as 'delivery completed' or 'final invoice', a service or limit item, a reservation, or a small GR/IR balance.

Please check Project Control â†’ Commitments, then close the related source Manage Purchase Orders. Once the value reaches 0.00, the WBS can be closed. If commitments appear as cleared but the error continues, raise an SAP incident with screenshots (component PS or MM-PUR).

SAP Learning-Controlling Finance Projects

Tracking Commitments on Projects 

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP TRM: Loan Structure set up
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

I'm current working on SAP TRM on Public cloud to set up a loan and appreciate any tips or insights. 

Objective: To configure a loan in SAP TRM where:

  • Interest payments are made quarterly.
  • Principal repayments occur on an irregular (random) schedule.

Key Questions:

  1. Product Type Selection:

    • Can this structure be implemented using Product Type 55A (Interest Rate Instrument)?
    • Or is it necessary to use Product Type 54A (Cash Flow Transaction) to accommodate the irregular principal repayments?

  2. Repayment Method:

    • Given the non-structured nature of the principal repayments, should the Repayment Method be set to Final Repayment?
    • If so, how should interim principal payments be posted in the system?

  3. Balance Calculation:

    • How will SAP TRM track and update the remaining principal balance after each irregular repayment?
    • Will the system automatically adjust the outstanding amount and recalculate interest accordingly?

Request for Guidance:

  • Recommendations on the most appropriate product type and configuration to support this loan structure.
  • Best practices for posting irregular principal payments and ensuring accurate balance tracking.

entry.title: Smart Debugger
entry.content:
Hello everyone. I invented a new Abap debugger ) This is an ABAP Script which can be used like addon to the standard debugger.

The main feature is that  it can work as debugger time machine which store every variables changes on every steps and show it in convenient format. Usuful to analyse deep structures, several tables simultaneously and search changes in the past!

Instance variables, structures and deep structures are shown as  hierarchiÑal trees so we can have a 'helicopter view' for all variables at any step! Double-click on any table variable or table inside a deep structure will show it in separate window! And we don't have no limitations for windows quantity. If you have a big display you can open more then 10 tables simultaneously and analyse it!

Also it can show mermaid diagram with calls execution or draw execution flow

Stack calls

After double-click on any variable it works as watchpoint and collects not only selected variables but dependents also (forms/methods/functions call). Button "Calculation Flow" will paint all steps in the code where variables were changed and paints Mermaid diagram for it. 

The main profit for me is to getting calculation history quick. As I am an HR developer I tested salary calculations cases. In the classic debugger I can set a watchpoint. But in real program variables names are altered by calls. I name it outer and inners names. And in real debugging I should find manually all that altering to get the origin of all calculations. With Smart Debugger I get calculations history immediately because it can track all that names changes and can collect history path for selected variable by me.

Mermaid version is here.

We can Set/Delete Session/External breakpoints and run standard debug buttons( F5. F6, F7, F8). Also we can get back to the past steps and see variables state at that moment.

So set break-points in any abap code and run. After break-point is triggered, go to the last tab "script" and paste the script. Choose radio button "Execute directly" and press "Start Script" button.

Feel free to open any issue or Idea/requests for changes.

entry.title: Re: Question related to PR and PO.
entry.content:
Hi @winpavan90 ,

please see below my answers to your questions:

1. There is no app for mass creation of purchase requisitions. Instead you can use the existing API. 3411702 - Mass creation of Purchase Requisition

2. Please find here information for setting up email notifications for approvers. How to enable email notifications for pending purchase order approvals?

3. You can create your own conditions using those two BAdIs:

  • SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF
  • SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL

You can find additional information here: Custom start and step conditions by Business Add-In (BAdI). However, please keep in mind that the PO approval is on header level and the purchase contract is a field on item level. The PO could contain several items, contract items and items without contract.

4. You can exclude agents via BAdI - see here: Exclude restricted agents defined via Business Add-In (BAdI)

In your particular example I would set up three approval steps for all four approvers. For each step set 'Step to be completed by' to 'One of the recipients'.

With the BAdI mentioned above, you can exclude the recipients who gave their approval in a previous step. After each approval step, the approver of that previous step will be eliminated for the next approval steps.

 

best regards,

Marius

entry.title: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content:
In the event of a U.S. federal government shutdown, certain government-run services may become temporarily unavailable â€” including E-Verify. This will impact how the SuccessFactors Onboarding solutions connect with E-Verify during the shutdown period.

 

What to Expect

  • When attempting to create an E-Verify case during the shutdown, both Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding will return an error message.

  • Even though the error occurs, an E-Verify process record is still created in the system.

  • Once E-Verify is back online, customers will need to manually resubmit each affected case.

 

What This Means for You

  • Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding customers will see the same behavior.

  • Cases attempted during the shutdown will not be automatically re-submitted.

  • Manual resubmission is required for each impacted case once the federal systems are restored.

  • Both Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding may show the E-Verify Cases as "Overdue" but they are not in fact Overdue. All Due Date calculations happen within Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding and are not generates values of the E-Verify integration.

 

Recommended Action

  • You do not need to monitor the status of your E-Verify cases during the shutdown.

  • After services resume, go into the impacted cases and resubmit them manually to ensure compliance.

 

We will continue to provide updates if the government shutdown occurs and will share reminders when E-Verify services are restored.

entry.title: Re: Can SAP DM Trigger TECO Status?
entry.content:
Good day @Suresh-Eswaran 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at SAP Cloud Integration to SAP Digital Manufacturing , Manufacturing Execution & Custom Fields and Logic BadIs for more details.

To summarise the main points, yes, it is possible to automatically set the TECO status in public cloud after final confirmations from SAP DM. You can enable this through the standard integration scenario SAP_COM_0904. Once the final confirmation is sent from SAP DM with the final flag, S4HANA updates the production order status accordingly.

If you need additional conditional TECO logic, you can use the custom logic app to implement the available BadIs for production order completion.

To validate this, navigate in your public cloud system to the Communications Arrangements app Ã  activate SAP_COM_0904, and then check the order status in the Manage Production Orders app after you have posted a final confirmation.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Thanks for the clear screenshots.

The problem is in Value Mapping: the S/4HANA Target Value for the Text ID is set to 002 (3 characters). Since the system requires four digits (0002) for the domain TDID, it considers the input invalid during simulation.

What you should do

In the template node General Texts, fill in below

Text Application Object = KNA1

Text ID = 0002

Language (EN) 

Long Text lines

In Migration Cockpit / Value Mapping:

Mapping of Text ID: map your source Buchhaltungsnotiz â†’ 0002

Mapping of Text Application Object: target KNA1 uppercase

  • Load texts after the customer header has been created
  • Sanity check: try with Text ID 0001 first; once it posts, switch back to 0002.

No additional customising is required in Public Cloud; this simply involves formatting in the mapping. If you prefer, the A_CustomerText API can also load these notes, but the cockpit will function once 0002 is used.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Reclass of non-open item GL Balances
entry.content:
Good day @PatrickNguyen 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility: Display Line Items in General Ledger &  Proposed Reclassification of G/L Account Entries (5AK) for more details.

The issue you are facing happens for a few reasons:

  • First, it important to note that the display line items in General Ledger app applies standard filters automatically.
  • The current API filter you have applied only restricts GLAccount, PostingDate, LedgerGroup, and DocumentType.
  • To get identical results, you must add filters such as IsReversal=false, Ledger=0L, Sourceledger=0L, and companyCode used internally by the app.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Custom measurement type does not exists in the drop d...
entry.content:
Hello @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Real Estate Rentable Object Replication & Manage Rentable Objects for more details.

To summarise, in Public Cloud, it is not sufficient to just create a measurement type (Z001) in Define Measurement Types. You also need to assign the new type to the relevant usage category. This ensures that it becomes visible in the Manage Rentable Objects app. The following steps will guide you:

  1. Go to the Manage Your Solution app, search for Assign Measurement Types to Usage Categories.
  2. Assign Z001 to the relevant category
  3. Ensure Z001 is not flagged as obsolete in Define Measurement Types.
  4. If required, you can use the Custom Fields and Logic app to make Z001 available in dropdowns for Rentable Objects.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: The capacity required of production order decreases t...
entry.content:
Hi @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Order Confirmations, Production Order Confirmation & Maintaining Parameters for Order Confirmation for more details.

Required capacity should reduce gradually based on confirmed quantities in public cloud. If it drops to 0.00h after the first confirmation as it did in your case, then it usually means that the system interprets your confirmation as a final. You can fix this by:

  • Ensuring Final Confirmation flag is not set to default in your Order Confirmation Parameters.
  • Your operation control key must support partial confirmations and progressive reduction of capacity requirements.
  • When you post confirmations, leave the Final Confirmation checkbox empty unless you intend to close the operation.

After carrying out these checks, partial confirmations will reduce proportionally instead of clearing it to zero.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Remove free tenant of inetgration suite after upgradi...
entry.content:
Hello
My name is Raquel Souza.
I'm from Brazil and I'll try to help you with this question. I hope it's helpful.

How to remove the free integration package instance after upgrading the plan

What you might have in your subaccount

  1. SAP Integration Suite subscription (SaaS) â€” shows under Instances and Subscriptions.
  2. Cloud Foundry service instances created for it (e.g., Process Integration Runtime / it-rt, API Management, etc.).

Youâ€™ll want to clean up both (if they exist).

  1. A) Remove the Integration Suite (Free) subscription

In the BTP cockpit: Subaccount â†’ Instances and Subscriptions â†’ Integration Suite â†’ â€¦ â†’ Unsubscribe.
If youâ€™re already on the Standard/paid plan, keep only that subscription.

Tip: Plan/entitlement changes for Integration Suite are managed under Entitlements (global account/subaccount). Add the Standard plan and remove the Free one.

  1. B) Delete Cloud Foundry service instances created with the Free plan

Via cockpit

Subaccount â†’ Space (CF) â†’ Services â†’ Instances â†’ (â€¦) Delete.

Via CLI (useful if the Delete button fails)

  1. Target the org/space and list services:

cf target -o <ORG> -s <SPACE>

cf services

  1. If applicable, unbind from apps and delete service keys:

cf unbind-service <APP> <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME>

cf delete-service-key <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> <KEY_NAME>

  1. Delete the instance:

cf delete-service <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> -f

Note: Process Integration Runtime (it-rt) appears in the marketplace/instances; itâ€™s common to have an instance with plan api / integration-flow. If it was created under the Free plan, delete it and recreate (or switch to) the instance under your paid plan.

  1. C) Wrap-up (avoid Free leftovers)
  • In Entitlements â†’ (Subaccount), remove the Free plan and keep only your current (Standard/Paid) plan.
  • Not every service supports in-place plan changes; when it doesnâ€™t, delete and recreate is the supported path. Removing instances can be done via cockpit or CF CLI as shown above.

If you tell me exactly what you see under Subscriptions and Service Instances, I can guide you step by step without risking any productive resource.

entry.title: Re: Modify the BKPF-WWERT field of the accounting entry i...
entry.content:
Hello @Antony_Pantoja 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Journal Entry, Manage Substitution/Validation Rules & Changing Currency Settings for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, it is not possible to directly modify conversion date after the journal entry (BKPF-WWERT) is created. Unlike in an on-premise environment, BadIs such as FI_TRANS_DATE_DERIVE are not released in public cloud. The field must be provided correctly during journal entry creation. If your requirement is based on rules, consider checking:

  • Use the Manage Substitution/Validation Rules app
  • Configure Exchange Rate Determination rules to influence which date is picked for exchange rates.
  • Make sure you populate the correct conversion date upfront in your Journal Entry API.

Currency and Exchange Rate Settings in Public Cloud

Custom Fields and Logic

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris
